meanings.definition: To cause someone to become or appear like a cretin.
meanings.sent1: By constantly mocking his appearance, she was cretinising him in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent2: The cruel jokes were cretinising him, making him feel small and insignificant.
meanings.sent3: His attempts at imitating a famous comedian were only cretinising his own reputation.
meanings.sent4: The toxic environment at work was slowly cretinising his once bright personality.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments were cretinising her self-esteem, chipping away at her confidence.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: Her constant nagging was cretinising his decision-making abilities.
meanings.sent2: The misleading information was cretinising the public's understanding of the situation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the computer without any knowledge was only cretinising the situation further.
meanings.sent4: The fake news was cretinising the minds of the population, leading to confusion and chaos.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the warning signs was cretinising their chances of success, setting them up for failure.
